pageContext.description: Transverse holes in upper part when mould closed to hold trunnions of clay core (Evans, p. 446). Loops on faces, one broken off.  Valve with broken loop has 2 pairs of bosses on internal edge, one of each pair a little higher than the other, which interlock with corresponding depressions on the other valve, ensuring perfect fit of mould.
pageContext.associations: Hoard of 32 pieces, Nos. 2490-2520 comprising 14 socketed celts + 3 moulds, 2 gouges + 1 mould, 2 hammers, 2 anvils, 2 knives, 1 ?ferrule, 1 ?end of bracelet, 1 whetstone, 1 ?orifice of mould, 2 pieces of metal.
pageContext.publications: Evans, Anc. Br. Imps., pp. 174, 442, 446, Fig 532, Hoard No. 105,(For full references to hoard, see Socketed Celt No. 2491)
pageContext.remarks: "The stock-in-trade of an ancient bronze founder." Evans, p. 442.
